title: With Critical Decisions Ahead, Netanyahu Faces Mounting Pressure
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel has a series of vexing choices to make in the year ahead on issues including Gaza, conscription and a judicial overhaul, with elections looming.

title: Zero Hour for the Middle East
summary: After more than a decade of wars, from Syria to Gaza, the Middle East is exhausted by conflict. Is it ready to find another way?

title: Zelensky and Netanyahu Go to Mar-a-Lago, and Student Loan Borrowers Face New Reality
summary: Plus, food trends coming in 2026.

title: For Zelensky, Just Keeping Trump Talking About Ukraine Peace Deal Counts as a Win
summary: Though discussions produced little tangible progress, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine at least avoided the type of setbacks that have blighted earlier meetings.

title: Trump and Zelensky Meet to Iron Out Peace Plan, but Deal Remains Elusive
summary: The U.S. president said after a meeting at Mar-a-Lago that a deal was “maybe very close.” But a joint U.S.-Ukraine proposal appeared unfinished, as Russia rejected several ideas.

title: Inside Marjorie Taylor Greene’s Break With Trump and MAGA
summary: How the Georgia congresswoman went from the president’s loudest cheerleader to his loudest Republican critic.

title: Five Takeaways From the New York Times Profile of Marjorie Taylor Greene
summary: The congresswoman discussed her break with President Trump and her journey from MAGA zealot to political isolation.

title: In Trump’s D.C. Crackdown, Murder Victims’ Families Say He’s Ignoring Them
summary: President Trump insists there are no more murders in Washington, D.C. “I wish that was true,” said Jamia Vaden, whose sister was gunned down in November.

title: How Kevin Hassett Became a Trump Loyalist and Fed Chair Contender
summary: Mr. Hassett’s evolution from conservative economist to defender of the president’s economic agenda has raised questions about how he would lead the central bank.

title: Trump Says the U.S. Struck a ‘Big Facility’ in Campaign Against Venezuela
summary: The administration provided no details of what the president said was an attack last week linked to U.S. efforts to disrupt drug trafficking from Latin America.

title: Suspect Confessed to Planting Pipe Bombs Near the Capitol Before Jan. 6
summary: A Virginia man was charged with planting the bombs outside Democratic and Republican headquarters. Court documents show he believed that the 2020 election had been “tampered with.”

title: How We’ll Eat in 2026: Food Forecasters Predict More Caution and More Crunch
summary: Food forecasters see a year of quieter tastes: little bursts of pleasure, less-jangling restaurants and healthy foods worthy of the ideal Grandma.

title: Uber Flags Sexual Misconduct but Many Drivers Stay on the Road
summary: The company monitors passenger feedback for risky driver behavior. Some accused of serious sexual assault had prior records of complaints.

title: China Will Hold Live-Fire Military Exercises Around Taiwan
summary: The exercises ended months of relative calm across the Taiwan Strait, and came after the Trump administration announced plans for arms sales to the island.

title: Experts Question Denmark’s Vaccine Program as a Model for the U.S.
summary: The United States is expected to adopt the vaccine schedule used by Denmark, a much smaller country with universal health care.

title: As Mamdani Leaves Queens for the Upper East Side, a Cool Welcome Awaits
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani loves his Astoria, Queens, neighborhood, and the feeling is mutual. But voters who live near Gracie Mansion, his new home, really wanted his opponent to win.

title: Can You Reboot a Lamp Like a Superhero Franchise?
summary: Riding an endless wave of nostalgia, one company is exhuming the intellectual property of midcentury designers to create new audiences for forgotten work.

title: Why We Keep Falling for Narcissistic Leaders
summary: We should know better.

title: What Happens When Your Therapist Dies?
summary: People don’t like to think about their own mortality, but therapists owe it to their patients to make plans.

title: Our Visual Journalism
summary: We look at the best graphics from The Times in 2025.

title: Parts of New York and New England Brace for Ice Storm
summary: Several states were under weather warnings or advisories early Monday. The same winter storm battered the Midwest over the weekend.

title: The World Wants More Ube. Philippine Farmers Are Struggling to Keep Up.
summary: Soaring demand and extreme weather worsened by climate change have wiped out harvests of the popular purple yam.

title: Mexico Train Derailment Kills 13 People
summary: The train was carrying around 250 passengers and crew members on a cross-country route linking the Pacific and the Gulf of Mexico. Nearly 100 people were injured.
